TopicTitle: [just curious] is it possible to change part's mass "on the fly" with a plugin ?

Articles.Content:
Hi,

just curious about what is possible to do with a plugin. I look at the some docs and see that part's characterics are properties which I guess are read-only, maybe I'm wrong.

I wish to know if it is possible to make a gui button to change the mass of a part, a kind of "base/twice" button.

Thanks.
Theoretically, you can do anything with a plugin. Now, this? Possible, but I don't know the details of how it could be done, so I'll digress to a proper coder for that.

Yes. Just change the part's mass field.

Ofc building a real plugin that does sth like that is more difficult, since you might have to do stuff like saving that data.
Part.mass is a public float but it's not explicitly persistent. You can try changing that for a given part; the mass seems to be saved in the persistence file nonetheless.
Hm, make it a tank and fuel generating as well - then set the maximum capacity real high, define a mass per unit for the resource and let the generating module work with magic alone?
